Line 6: Line 6:
'''Silk Road''' is an online [[marketplace]] that its operators run as a [[Tor_(anonymity_network)#Hidden_services|Tor hidden service]]. As such, visitors must use [[Tor (anonymity network)|Tor]] to access the marketplace. Buyers and sellers conduct all transactions with [[bitcoin]]s. The website started operating in February 2011.<ref name="dbvc">{{Cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/technology/technology-news/drugs-bought-with-virtual-cash-20110611-1fy0a.html |title=Drugs bought with virtual cash |author=Justin Norrie & Asher Moses |accessdate=14 June 2011 |date=12 June 2011 |newspaper=Sydney Morning Herald |publisher=Fairfax Media }}</ref>
'''Silk Road''' is an online [[marketplace]] that its operators run as a [[Tor_(anonymity_network)#Hidden_services|Tor hidden service]]. As such, visitors must use [[Tor (anonymity network)|Tor]] to access the marketplace. Buyers and sellers conduct all transactions with [[bitcoin]]s. The website started operating in February 2011.<ref name="dbvc">{{Cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/technology/technology-news/drugs-bought-with-virtual-cash-20110611-1fy0a.html |title=Drugs bought with virtual cash |author=Justin Norrie & Asher Moses |accessdate=14 June 2011 |date=12 June 2011 |newspaper=Sydney Morning Herald |publisher=Fairfax Media }}</ref>
â
In reaction to a [[Gawker]] article on the marketplace, US Senators [[Charles Schumer]] and [[Joe Manchin]], and the [[Wall Street Journal]]<ref>Adrian Chen (June 1 2011).[http://gawker.com/5805928/the-underground-website-where-you-can-buy-any-drug-imaginable The Underground Website Where You Can Buy Any Drug Imaginable]. Gawker.</ref> sent a letter to the [[Drugs Enforcement Agency]] insisting that the agency shut down the marketplace.<ref name="bthc">{{Cite news |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/technology/2011/jun/12/bitcoin-online-currency-us-government |title=Bitcoin: the hacker currency that's taking over the web |author=Ruth Whippman |accessdate=13 June 2011 |date=12 June 2011 |work=guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian News and Media Limited }}</ref> After this traffic to the website increased dramatically and bitcoins saw a corresponding rise in value.<ref name="dbvc"/>
+
In reaction to a [[Gawker]] article on the marketplace, US Senators [[Charles Schumer]] and [[Joe Manchin]], and the [[Wall Street Journal]]<ref>Adrian Chen (June 1 2011).[http://gawker.com/5805928/the-underground-website-where-you-can-buy-any-drug-imaginable The Underground Website Where You Can Buy Any Drug Imaginable]. Gawker.</ref> sent a letter to the [[Drugs Enforcement Agency]] insisting that the agency shut down the marketplace.<ref name="bthc">{{Cite news |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/technology/2011/jun/12/bitcoin-online-currency-us-government |title=Bitcoin: the hacker currency that's taking over the web |author=Ruth Whippman |accessdate=13 June 2011 |date=12 June 2011 |work=guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian News and Media Limited }}</ref> After this traffic to the website increased dramatically and [[bitcoins]] saw a corresponding rise in value.<ref name="dbvc"/>
Sellers are mostly based in the USA and Britain.<ref name="dbvc"/>
Sellers are mostly based in the USA and Britain.<ref name="dbvc"/>
